text:
We appreciate Dr. Battacharya’s willingness to meet with @HouseIntel about our investigation into the IC’s mishandling of AHIs. 

The IC generated and utilized the NIH study’s invalid results to prop up the highly flawed intelligence community assessment. Amongst the many issues involved, the withholding of medical care to force participation in this human subject research study, as directed by personnel in the IC, betrayed those desperately seeking help.
 
I am grateful for @RepRonnyJackson’s continued leadership on this @HouseIntel investigation to uncover the truth for those victims.

Congratulations to Director Street on his confirmation as NCSC Director. With his U.S. Army background, he brings the skills necessary to usher NCSC into a new era. I look forward to working with Director Street as we look to address the disjointed U.S. counterspy apparatus and build a more unified, strategic effort to proactively disable, disrupt, and neutralize the foreign intelligence threat in the homeland.

Today, I voted in favor of the @HouseGOP  CR to keep our government running beyond Sept. 30th. This plan prevents a harmful shutdown, prioritizes fiscal responsibility, and serves the American people. I look forward to seeing my colleagues in the Senate pass this legislation so that the government can remain open and we can continue delivering wins for our constituents back at home #AR01
Yesterday, my staff and I had the privilege to put together care packages for our brave servicemembers out in the field. Thank you @The_USO  for hosting such a special event https://t.co/mrBAGtoSwD

I want to wish a happy 78th Birthday to the @USAirForce! I'm proud to honor the servicemembers who defend our skies, protect American interests, and secure our nation. Your courage & innovation are crucial to our warfighting ability. Thank you for your service! 🇺🇸✈️ #AirForceBirthday #AR01

I was honored to join my House colleagues to remember the life and legacy of Charlie Kirk. Charlie was a bold champion of conservative principles and free speech, and a great American who loved this country. His legacy will continue to inspire and shape future generations. https://t.co/qhsPaDOnku

Honored to announce this @HouseIntel review of the 9/11 Commission's intelligence recommendations. While the threats look different today, the mission remains the same: we can never allow a failure to connect the dots to result in catastrophe ever again. 

More from @RobyBrock here: https://t.co/ViALIeTdl8

Thank you to all the local, state, and federal law enforcement who didn’t rest until this terrorist was apprehended. Under Director Patel and AG Bondi’s leadership, I am confident justice for Charlie will be served and I strongly encourage them to make an example of this cowardly scumbag.

Today, we remember and honor those lives lost in the September 11th terrorist attacks on the United States. We remember the first responders who ran toward danger without hesitation and the heroes who sacrificed their lives to save others. The words “Never Forget” continue to serve as a commitment to always honor those lives lost.

I am devastated by the assassination of Charlie Kirk, and I am praying for his family and loved ones. He will always be the voice that shaped a generation of conservatism, and that will live on. I have complete confidence in FBI Director Patel to carry out a robust and rapid investigation to bring the assassin to justice. Today was nothing short of an act of terrorism. Our nation is at a turning point—a critical vector—and it’s time to decide what we want the United States to stand for going forward. Because if history has shown us anything, the path of political violence we are on is a dangerous one.

.@HouseIntel just passed the #FY26IAA out of Committee, delivering on @POTUS' agenda by taking bold, unprecedented steps to return the IC to its high-stakes mission by:

✅Modernizing & optimizing our nation's counterintelligence enterprise to be more agile and responsive 
✅Preventing politicization and weaponization of the IC
✅Expediting the usage of AI in the Intelligence Community
✅ Focusing on the prevention and response efforts to growing biothreats

More here: https://t.co/ixLg4pdeOe

Yet another jaw-dropping example that supports @HouseIntel’s strong case for long-overdue reform of the U.S. counterintelligence enterprise. For decades, our adversaries and foreign governments have treated the American homeland as their own turf because we have allowed them. 

@HouseIntel has been working since January to address the failures of the CI enterprise and realign all IC entities to build the counterintelligence capability America needs now in this year’s #FY26IAA.

STEM drives our country forward and fostering our youth's interest in it is one of the best investments we can make. That's why I’m thrilled to kick off the 2025 Congressional App Challenge for AR-01 high schoolers. Submit your apps by Oct. 30 at https://t.co/PtkeHKtVDM. #AR01 #STEM

I was proud to support this critical legislation, which includes my funding request to begin expanding the Osceola Harbor. As a vital hub for our regional economy, lengthening the Osceola Harbor by an additional 3,000 feet will support the continued rapid growth in steel and agriculture production in NE Arkansas. I hope the Senate can pass this bill quickly and get it to President Trump’s desk.

I commend the Trump admin for sending this powerful message. We must be taking all necessary steps to protect U.S. technology leadership in microelectronics and artificial intelligence. The CCP does not play by the rules and will stop at nothing in its mission for global dominance. The United States should not be aiding, involuntarily or voluntarily, the advancement of Chinese AI technology and must ensure all safeguards are in place to combat this glaring national security threat. I encourage the administration to evaluate whether similar actions are warranted for other technology companies.

A very blatant and aggressive display of how our adversaries are now working together, colluding to inflict the greatest harm on the United States. They adapt rapidly to leverage any weakness in the U.S. security posture. This is a glaring reminder of the importance of refocusing intel efforts with our key Western Hemisphere neighbors.

.@ODNIgov was never meant to be a bloated organization plagued by redundancies, inefficiencies, and waste.

@DNIGabbard’s ODNI 2.0 initiative will take the first step to return the critical intelligence agency to its original national security mission. https://t.co/2N5ih6ISGs

Today, we remember the 13 brave servicemembers who lost their lives at Abbey Gate four years ago while carrying out their mission under impossibly difficult circumstances in Afghanistan.

We will never forget. We are a nation indebted to them for their service.
We are praying that everyone stays safe and for our first responders as they manage this situation. If you are in the area, please follow all safety alerts.

Based on the information being reported, this is another example of Washington politicians, from James Comey to Adam Schiff and now John Bolton, who have disgraced themselves and the offices they held for personal advancement.  This is unacceptable. There must be immediate accountability.  Great Americans from across the country place their lives on the line and sacrifice to collect intelligence for the United States, only to have beltway politicians compromise that information for personal and political gains.  If a low level intelligence officer or military service member did this, they would be prosecuted, lose their clearance, and be jailed.  Senior leaders must be held to the same standard.

I am monitoring this situation closely.  While all accused are presumed innocent until proven guilty in a court of law, the news of this situation is incredibly troubling.  Nobody is above the law.  I thank @FBIDirectorKash and @AGPamBondi for their professionalism in ensuring this case moves forward to conclusion.

Congratulations to Joe Francescon on his nomination as the Deputy Director of the National Security Agency. His depth of experience and strong commitment to securing our nation make him a great pick. The @HouseIntel Committee and I look forward to working with him in his new role.

I commend @DNIGabbard for taking bold, unprecedented action to get at the redundancies, inefficiencies, politicization, and weaponization of the Intelligence Community. Anyone involved in the IC and intelligence oversight has known for over a decade that the @ODNIgov has been in desperate need of reform to return the agency to its critical national security mission. This is an excellent first step in the right direction.

.@HouseIntel looks forward to continuing to work with Director Gabbard as she acts to right-size ODNI and maximize its impact for the American people. @POTUS and @DNIGabbard are leading the charge by not just calling out the problems but taking action to address them.

This groundbreaking marks the beginning of a new era for our community. The new commercial terminal at the Jonesboro Municipal Airport is not only going to connect Arkansans to broader markets, but is also going to connect those outside markets to everything Jonesboro and the Arkansas Delta offers. I am excited to see this new era of air-travel in our backyard!
https://t.co/TlLQRMwWGp

Today, August 7, as a nation we recognize Purple Heart Day.

The oldest American military merit award, the Purple Heart is awarded to members of the armed forces who have been wounded or killed in action. Let us join together and honor the brave men and women who sacrificed body and life for our freedoms. May we never forget their sacrifices.

The OBBB will have major positive impacts for all Arkansans, including our farmers and producers. Here is a snapshot of some benefits that we can expect going forward. Thanks to @POTUS’ leadership, Congressional Republicans took action to safeguard Americans and open opportunities for further economic growth.

Congrats to @DepDNILukas on his swearing-in as Principal Deputy Director of National Intelligence. With over two decades of experience, he brings foundational knowledge paired with his operational background, making him a valuable addition to the ODNI leadership team. 

I look forward to working with Aaron in his new capacity to ensure the Intelligence Community is set on the path to rebuild trust with the American people.

The Russia hoax will go down as one of the most troublesome events in U.S. history. A President of the United States was falsely accused, and a nation had to endure lies fabricated by rogue personnel within their own Intelligence Community. To this day, our country is more polarized than ever before, and the Russia hoax played a role in that. 

There are still Americans who passionately believe the fabricated narrative. That is why releasing this document to the public has been so important. @DNIGabbard

NEWS: Today, @DNIGabbard declassified the 2017 HPSCI Majority staff report, which is the FINAL nail in the coffin of the Russia hoax, which has perpetrated the greatest political fraud on the American people for over 8 years and undermined President Trump’s first term in office. 

This report, for the first time, exposes in-depth details on how the Intelligence Community manufactured the Russia collusion hoax.

https://t.co/Xk2cds3uws
Congratulations @RepGarbarino! I look forward to working closely with you on securing our homeland 🇺🇸

To impose large-scale change that gets at redefining the underlying culture, the IC has to be honest about the issues plaguing its analytic integrity. The American people are not to be manipulated with using manufactured or misrepresented intelligence that pushes one political or personal agenda. 

President Trump and @DNIGabbard deserve credit for continuing to follow through on @POTUS’ commitment to transparency and accountability.

CCP-controlled companies have long manipulated our economy by exploiting loopholes to access taxpayer funding that should be going towards U.S.-owned companies, which my STOP China Act aims to address.

During this week's @TransportGOP hearing with @SecDuffy, we discussed ways to enforce current law to protect U.S. national security, strengthen American manufacturing, and prevent Chinese entities from undercutting U.S. transit supply chains. WATCH HERE ⤵️

Adequate and safe parking is a top priority for our nation’s trucking industry, which is the backbone of U.S. commerce. With little to no progress made on the EV charging stations, I encouraged @SecDuffy to consider redirecting the $7.5B for EV infrastructure to support truck parking. WATCH HERE ⤵️

Arkansas’s trucking industry relies on safe and efficient policies that keep our roads safe for all those who use them. Today, I introduced the "Drug and Alcohol Clearinghouse Public Safety Improvement Act," which will address a long-overdue HHS testing delay and create a more equitable process for hiring truck drivers. More here ➡️
https://t.co/AxZXVY0h3N

This headline is almost unimaginable. By leveraging a known agent of the CCP to collect and store insurmountable amounts of sensitive data, Spain has made itself vulnerable to clear threats to the security and sovereignty of not only itself but allies around the world. With every country that opens its doors to Huawei, they are only providing more opportunities for the CCP-controlled company to mine data used to advance the geopolitical goals of the CCP. 

https://t.co/2Ngpd9jr7k

Great news out of @USDA! Eligible producers can sign up with their County FSA Office beginning tomorrow or wait for a pre-filled application to come in the mail, which the USDA has begun sending out today.

For more information on SDRP eligibility or other supplemental disaster relief programs funded through the American Relief Act (including ECAP), please check out the USDA’s Disaster Supplemental page on their website or contact your local FSA Office.

Thank you to @HouseAgGOP Chairman @CongressmanGT for his leadership on this effort and to @SecRollins for the fast rollout of these funds to help farmers!
Thank you to Governor @SarahHuckabee for being a leader in protecting farms and farmers in Arkansas and across the nation from malign foreign actors.

In the FY24 Intel Authorization Act that was signed into law, I championed an authorization for a counterintelligence office dedicated to supporting the @USDA in understanding these types of threats to U.S. agriculture. However, the Biden admin refused to implement this law and establish the office. 

This office is vital to connecting the dots in the effort to secure our nation's agriculture industry.

Joined @GowdyAmerica to discuss the latest on Russia, Iran, and the @HouseIntel Committee's efforts to address the deep-seated analytic integrity issues throughout the Intelligence Community. https://t.co/1wtQAAMhgb

Today we celebrate 249 years of American independence and freedom.  We honor all those who have fought and continue to fight to defend the freedoms we hold so dear. Have a safe and happy Fourth of July. 🇺🇸

When I became Chair of @HouseIntel, I swore we would address analytic integrity and start holding those who refuse to do the right thing accountable. I refuse to let this Committee become part of the problem that envelopes parts of the IC, including senior leadership who seek to thwart the President’s agenda.

https://t.co/z3XLnJAhKJ

The CIA’s self-review of its 2016 Intelligence Community Assessment on Russian Election Interference falls FAR SHORT of the full truth. It is abysmal CIA would put out a memo with half-truths, inaccuracies, and blatant omissions about the full extent of the Russia hoax and the deep state’s role. Even worse, they released this report while holding the Intel Committee’s report on the same issue hostage for 7 years.

Thanks to the swift response and intervention from @POTUS and the @WhiteHouse after receiving my letter, our investigative document on the Russia hoax has been handed over by the CIA and is back in the Committee’s custody.

How the One Big Beautiful Bill Benefits Arkansans:

✅The average taxpayer in Arkansas’s 1st District would have seen a 24% increase in their federal taxes if Congress had not passed this legislation.

✅This bill includes the first meaningful investment in the farm safety net programs, such as ARC and PLC, since 2012. 

✅To further support our Arkansas farmers, the bill includes up to a 20% increase in the statutory reference prices for all covered commodities and encourages access to commercial export markets for agricultural producers.

Today, I proudly voted to preserve the largest tax cut in history for working and middle-class Americans, bolster border security, make a significant investment in U.S. national security, and provide much-needed relief for Arkansas farmers that will set them on a path to long-term success. 

Bottom line: this legislation puts Americans in a safer and more prosperous position than they were before.
Pretty incredible! Thank you @rep_stevewomack! 👏

I appreciate the efforts of @FBIDirectorKash and the men and women of the FBI here. But this problem is so widespread throughout the U.S. homeland and our nation’s intelligence apparatus is woefully unprepared, for a variety of reasons, to combat and prevent adversaries from operating on our own soil.
 
The time is now to take bold action and build a counterintelligence capability that neutralizes foreign intel entities while enhancing Americans’ Constitutional rights. More to come on this from @HouseIntel.

I am furious with the repeated, blatant disregard for the very simple, proper handling of classified information. When leakers leverage their access to highly sensitive information to push a political or personal agenda it is to the detriment of U.S. national security and incredibly disrespectful to those who put their lives on the line for our country collecting intelligence and supporting our mission on the ground. 

Access to classified information is a privilege and with that comes the utmost responsibility to safeguard that information with the highest level of caution and care. 

I will continue to work with the Administration to ensure information to keep Congress fully and currently informed is shared via the appropriate Committees with appropriate oversight responsibilities. This reckless and dangerous behavior must end–full stop.

Yesterday, I had the opportunity to fly a 5th generation F-35 aircraft, completing aerial maneuvers and firing munitions! Getting just a glimpse of the flight training our exceptional military members experience everyday was truly eye-opening. I’d like to thank Lockheed Martin for hosting this spectacular event.

My team and I have been notified that my office contact information is temporarily unavailable on my website. While we're working to get this function back up and running ASAP, if you need to contact me, you can still do so.  You can always reach me through the “Contact Me” function on my site, or by calling my Washington, D.C., or Jonesboro Offices.
Washington D.C.: 202-225-4076
Jonesboro: 870-203-0540
I look forward to hearing from you!

As I have said multiple times recently, I regret that Iran has brought the world to this point. That said, I am thankful President Trump understood that the red line—articulated by Presidents of both parties for decades—was real. The United States and our allies, including Israel, are making it clear that the world would never accept Iran’s development of a nuclear weapon.

I have been in touch with the White House before this action and will continue to track developments closely with them in the coming days. I commend President Trump for taking decisive action and I am grateful to the U.S. servicemembers who carried out these precise and successful strikes. I continue to pray for the safety of the forces engaged to protect the free world.

Our adversaries are constantly looking to exploit our weaknesses. Future wars will have an active cyber front line and the U.S. must do more to build up both defensive and offensive capabilities to deter and respond. 

More on how I see the current threat landscape evolving in my convo with @McCraryCyber here: 
https://t.co/LDrPqvuCHV

Congratulations to our very own Cross County Elementary Technology Academy for being named one of the Top 10 Schools in the World by T4 Education in the Overcoming Adversity category! From the heart of the Delta, over the last 5 years CCETA has become a beacon of success for professional development and student performance. Standing as a true testament to the resilience of our region, this is only the beginning of the success stories we will hear out of CCETA as their students continue to grow as members of our community. We in the First District are all very proud of CCETA’s accomplishments.

Congratulations to @U_S_Steel on sealing its historic partnership with Nippon Steel, which will bring billions of dollars in investment and create thousands of jobs in Arkansas and around the country. 

Thank you to @POTUS for his bold leadership in approving this America First partnership. 

After decades of U.S. manufacturing vanishing overseas, we are finally onshoring and bringing jobs back to the U.S. I look forward to the investments this partnership will make in Arkansas’s First Congressional District: the Steel-Making Capital of America. This is truly a great day for our nation!

I joined the @IntlSpyMuseum's "SpyCast" podcast to discuss my priorities as Chairman of @HouseIntel including combatting the growing influence of the CCP in the Western Hemisphere, addressing the analytic integrity issues in the IC, and strengthening the U.S. counterintelligence posture to secure our homeland.

LISTEN HERE ⤵️ https://t.co/Iy3Dd1fGPi
250 years of defending our great nation and protecting the freedoms we hold so dear. Happy birthday to the United States Army! https://t.co/pAEcNnofer

Iran pushed the world to this point through its blatant, relentless destabilizing behavior. Israel and others in the region have every right to take the actions needed to defend themselves. More on my thoughts on Israel’s strikes against Iran here ⬇️ https://t.co/iIun6a7SYn
Congratulations to the Trumann Fire Department for being awarded this distinguished recognition. We are so grateful for all you do to keep our community safe.

Parents!
Encourage reading this summer by participating in the Second Lady Summer Reading Challenge📕📙! Open to students K-8, participants who read 12 books and complete the reading log will receive a small prize and a chance to visit the Nation’s Capital. Challenge ends September 5th, 2025, more information can be found at https://t.co/OvfXr7rric.

The First District is home to so many talented young people and yesterday my office had the pleasure of hosting Miss Rachael Skinner of Brookland, our 2025 Congressional Art Competition Best-in-Show winner! Her piece "Current River" will be on display in the U.S. Capitol for the next year.

The latest report of an agroterrorism attempt by Chinese nationals only reinforces the need for stronger collaboration between @USDA and the intelligence community to protect our nation's agriculture industry. Food security is national security. 

During today's @HouseAgGOP, I asked @SecRollins about the status of setting up a counterintelligence office, my legislation authorized last Congress, dedicated to supporting the USDA in understanding these types of threats to U.S. agriculture.

Arkansas is hands down the best state in the country to live in. Our state has a small-town feel and realtors are an important piece to helping people make Arkansas home. Thanks to the Arkansas Realtors Association for inviting me to speak with you all this morning. https://t.co/DKzC2lE6cN

I am closely tracking the targeted terror attack in Boulder, CO this evening. I am confident the FBI and local law enforcement will thoroughly investigate to ensure those responsible are held accountable. Our prayers are with all the victims and their families.

Attacks like this against Jewish community members have become far too frequent and are a direct result of the dangerous and charged rhetoric against the Jewish community. Enough is enough.

I want to commend the meticulous work of the investigative team at the @FBI that, under the leadership of @FBIDirectorKash, has blown the cover off this attempted espionage effort and neutralized any potential threat. The United States will never stand for attempts to degrade our national security and threaten Americans' safety.

I remain concerned about the number of counterintelligence threats penetrating all levels and branches of government. They are only increasing and becoming more persistent. As Chairman, I am laser-focused on working to put the needed reforms in place to ensure our counterintelligence posture can adapt as rapidly as the enemies' strategy does and address any points of vulnerability.

Today's arrest is further evidence of @DNIGabbard 's follow through on her promise to bring accountability to the IC for leakers and those seeking to harm our country from within. Americans' trust in the intelligence community will never be restored if they don't see major, seismic changes to the current intelligence community. The removal of this traitor should be a warning to anyone seeking to disrupt the integrity of our intelligence institutions and keeps me encouraged that this cadre of IC leadership will return our intelligence agencies back to their intended missions.

It was great to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the  @LOrealUSA North Little Rock plant today alongside Governor @SarahHuckabee and the Arkansas delegation. @LOrealUSA employs over 500 Arkansans and has been a staple in our local economy for decades. https://t.co/Uc99SDa3S1

Thank you to the Stuttgart Rotary Club for inviting me to share an update from D.C., including what we are working on in the @HouseIntel Committee and how the @HouseAgGOP Committee is advancing the Farm Bill. It was a great discussion. https://t.co/rgK8F05nz8

It was an honor to speak to this year’s ALA Arkansas Girls State delegates as they embarked on a week-long program focused on the importance of civic engagement and leadership. It was wonderful to see the next generation of America’s leaders. https://t.co/XL1PuEkhxm

I had a great visit today with @NationalGuard Arkansas Adjutant General Bridges. I am grateful for his service and leadership in ensuring Arkansas’ men and women in uniform are prepared to serve our state and our nation in times of crisis. https://t.co/8xpZwlrSar

From the growing influence of the CCP in the Western Hemisphere to Iran’s increasingly destabilizing behavior around the world and Russia’s continued aggression and irregular activities, the U.S. and our allies are facing an unprecedented myriad of threats from highly sophisticated adversaries.

More from my conversation with @ChrisStirewalt on the greatest intelligence threats facing the United States here⤵️
Today we honor and remember all those men and women who answered the call and made the ultimate sacrifice to defend our nation and our freedom. https://t.co/xahlaNKrvC

Last November, Americans delivered a very clear message when they elected President Donald Trump to a second term. They called for historic change. The ball was then in Congress’ court to codify the President’s agenda, which he quickly moved to implement on day one. 

Today, House Republicans are putting Americans’ hard-earned money back into their pockets, making safety net programs better serve those who really need them, strengthening border security, reviving energy dominance, and injecting life back into the economy—all in a fiscally responsible manner.

I am closely tracking developments in the reporting of a shooting of two Israeli embassy staff tonight. This type of violence cannot be tolerated. I trust local and federal authorities will spare no expense to fully investigate and locate the shooter.

Our prayers are with the victims and their families.

This is problematic and very concerning. We must protect Americans’ constitutional rights and civil liberties while ensuring the IC has the tools it needs to combat THE REAL THREATS from our foreign adversaries.
https://t.co/YVQbCgG73Z

The U.S. must leverage all tools in our toolbox to secure the U.S. semiconductor supply chain and restrict the CCP’s exploitation of U.S. technologies and intellectual property.

The CCP does not play by the rules and will stop at no end in its mission for global dominance. We should not be aiding involuntarily or voluntarily the advancement of Chinese AI technology.

As we close out #PoliceWeek, I would like to thank the brave, selfless men and women of law enforcement who put their lives on the line every day to protect our communities across the country. The safety and stability of our local communities depend on robust support of law enforcement.

.@DNIGabbard understands that for the IC to successfully carry out its mission, the American people and their leaders must trust they are getting unfiltered information. I appreciate her follow through on her promise to address the issues around transparency, as well as, righting the wrongs woven throughout the institution.

I've been very clear on my concerns about the National Intelligence Council’s inability to execute a process for developing intel assessments that effectively document and address all views. We've seen very high-profile examples of this utter failure to adhere to analytic standards and deliver assessments free of personal, political, institutional, or ideological bias, as is required by law.  

Correcting the direction of a large ship will never be easy. It’s bound to be laden with obstructions and those looking to undermine change. I commend @DNIGabbard for making the hard decisions and following through on her promises to increase accountability.

Today, we celebrate the 80th anniversary of victory in Europe. It is because of the bravery and resilience of the Greatest Generation that we have our freedom today. Please join me in honoring the brave men and women who stood up in our darkest hour to defend our freedom. https://t.co/P4jG2Lr6e5

The CCP’s poisonous alliance with Cuba has posed significant threats to U.S. national security for decades. Their alleged involvement in signals intelligence hubs in Cuba is outward, unconcealed adversarial behavior against the U.S. The CCP’s actions are becoming increasingly more bold and thereby detrimental to Western Hemisphere security.  

Focusing intel efforts back to the Western Hemisphere and the U.S. neighborhood is a top priority of @HouseIntel

As we celebrate this National Small Business Week, I’d like to take the time to congratulate Whitton Farms of Tyronza and ControlTek Inc. of Jonesboro on being named Category I and II Business of the Year by Arkansas Business!
https://t.co/9Zr7J1Nx04

This week @HouseIntel released an oversight report into the FBI's failed, misguided investigation into the 2017 Congressional Baseball Game shooting that was plagued by bias and a lack of accountability. 

My tenure as @HouseIntel Chairman will be marked by rigorous oversight of the Intelligence Community to address the significant degradation of investigative and analytic integrity. More from my interview with @MariaBartiromo here ⤵️

Nurses are the backbone of our healthcare system and I am proud to celebrate all of the wonderful nurses in Arkansas' First District this National Nurses Week. Serving on the front lines, our nurses provide world-class care and compassion to our community and should be celebrated not during just this week, but every day.

🚨REAL ID enforcement begins TOMORROW 🚨

Starting tomorrow passengers who present a state-issued ID that is not REAL ID-compliant at TSA checkpoints and who do not have another acceptable alternative form of ID, such as a passport, may be subjected to additional screening.

Plan ahead to ensure that your travel plans are not interrupted and review TSA's acceptable identification list here:
https://t.co/YaIrvGt9Xy

Join me in celebrating all of Arkansas’ wonderful educators today on National Teachers Day! Outstanding teachers better our children's lives and our communities. The dedication and passion teachers bring into their classrooms every day fosters an environment in which our children can learn valuable life lessons that they will carry with them long after they leave the classroom. I am thankful for their commitment to our next generation of leaders.

I want to express my sincerest appreciation to @FBIDirectorKash for his swift follow-through on his commitment to transparency and working with Congress.

Director Patel committed to providing @HouseIntel with this case file at the opening of our Worldwide Threats hearing last month. Before we gaveled the hearing out about 2 hours later, his team had already delivered it to the Intelligence Committee offices.

There is no reasonable or acceptable explanation for why the FBI stonewalled the @HouseIntel for so long. This report confirms that under previous FBI leadership, the Bureau completely botched the investigation into this politically motivated attack which threatened the lives of numerous Republican Members of Congress, staff, and bystanders. 

It is alarming that the FBI would approach any investigation within its purview with this complete disregard and lack of investigative integrity. Since joining @HouseIntel, it has been one of my top priorities to address the degradation of the intelligence community’s analytical integrity. 

We are just getting started.

Congratulations to the three Cabot High School students I nominated for service academies who were recognized for receiving appointments to their respective institutions.   By committing to serving, they are answering a higher call, one to ensure that future generations have access to the same freedoms and opportunities we enjoy in America today. Thank you for choosing this journey.   

(L to R) Vincent Rodriguez accepted an appointment to the U.S. Military Academy. Garrett Allen received an appointment to the U.S. Air Force Academy. Kyle Chamness accepted an offer to attend the U.S. Military Academy.

Our women and men in uniform represent some of the best our nation has to offer. We are a nation indebted to their selfless sacrifice and commitment to defend the freedoms we enjoy every day in America. Thank you to all those who have answered the call to serve. https://t.co/7pDw4BJHDk

I enjoyed meeting with the @ARStateChamber to discuss the issues most pressing to our state's business environment. It's important to hear from our state’s business leaders on how we can better protect our state’s industries from foreign interference. As Arkansas continues to grow its presence in the global marketplace, malicious actors such as China will take notice.

Congratulations to the three Cabot High School students I nominated for service academies who were recognized for receiving appointments to their respective institutions. 

By committing to serving, they are answering a higher call, one to ensure that future generations have access to the same freedoms and opportunities we enjoy in America today. Thank you for choosing this journey. 

(L to R) Vincent Rodriguez accepted an appointment to the U.S. Military Academy. Garrett Allen received an appointment to the U.S. Air Force Academy. Kyle Chamness accepted an offer to attend the Naval Academy Preparatory School.

During today's @TransportGOP hearing, I called out the imbalance in the Highway Trust Fund user-pays system which allows EV owners to contribute significantly less while they cause more wear and tear on our roads than the traditional combustion engine car due to their weight. The witnesses and I discussed what should be done to ensure EV owners pay their fair share to the fund which maintains our nation’s highways.

Enjoyed catching up with @RobyBrock to discuss my work on @HouseIntel, what needs to be done about the growing threat from China and Russia in the Western Hemisphere, tariffs, and more. Listen here: https://t.co/syV5Aeo9cJ

IMPORTANT update for Arkansans: The REAL ID deadline is quickly approaching on May 7th. 

If you still need to upgrade your current ID to the REAL ID, this Saturday, April 26, the Arkansas Department of Finance & Administration will be opening several Revenue Offices solely for issuing REAL IDs. Locations in and around the First District are:

- Jonesboro Revenue Office: 206 Southwest Drive

The IRS has just announced that ALL Arkansans qualify for disaster tax relief! Individuals, businesses, and 1040 filers now have until Nov. 3rd, 2025, to file their returns and make payments!

For more information please see below:
REMINDER: Tax Day is tomorrow. Please see the below to ensure your taxes are processed on time.⤵️

🚨Important Tax Day Update🚨

After speaking with the USPS, my office highly recommends taking the following steps to ensure that your taxes are processed on time:

USPS Blue Mailbox—If you are placing your tax return into a USPS blue mailbox, you must do so by COB April 14th. Failure to do so could result in your return being processed late.

Mailing on April 15th—If you are mailing your taxes on April 15th, go in person to your local post office and ask for your envelope to be hand-stamped with the current date.

As an extra precaution, to track your tax return through the mail, you can send your tax return by certified mail, which comes with a return receipt. Certified mail does come at an additional cost.

President Trump promised throughout his campaign that he would restore the American people's faith in their government, and I believe he is well on his way to fulfilling that promise. President Trump's strong leadership has also had an immediate effect on our nation's border crisis. I look forward to working with the Trump administration as we usher in a new Golden Age of America and regain the trust of the American people.

Today I proudly voted in favor of H.R. 26, the Protecting Energy Production Act. This legislation prohibits the President from banning hydraulic fracturing, also known as fracking, unless Congress authorizes the ban.

Over the last four years, our nation’s energy producers have been limited by the Biden administration and its Green New Deal failures; this ends now. Advancing our nation’s energy production makes us more secure and lowers energy prices for Americans. The moment our nation becomes reliant on other countries for our energy needs is the moment we say goodbye to our national security. I am proud to have supported this legislation and look forward to continuing to work alongside President Trump to restore America's energy dominance.

As President Trump works to reverse the Biden-Harris Administration’s disastrous border policies that allowed for drug cartels to traffic fentanyl throughout our nation, I am proud to have supported H.R. 27, the HALT Fentanyl Act. H.R. 27 strengthens our ability to prosecute traffickers, acts as a deterrent against dangerous drug cartels, and permanently closes the analogue loophole in the Controlled Substances Act.

Communities across the country have been plagued by the fentanyl crisis, and with this common-sense legislation, we move one step closer to eradicating fentanyl-related substances from our streets.

I am truly honored to be selected to lead the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence. I look forward to working with Speaker Johnson and the incoming Trump administration team to advance priorities that are important to Americans.

Since joining the Committee in 2017, I have witnessed firsthand that abuse within our nation’s security apparatus has eroded trust in our institutions and compromised America’s ability to gather intelligence. As Chairman, I will aggressively uphold our mandate to provide credible and robust oversight of the Intelligence Community’s funding and activities. Without aggressive oversight and vigorous protection of Americans’ Fourth Amendment rights, the IC is prone to give in to mission creep and skirt U.S. laws. In all our work, I pledge to preserve Americans’ constitutional rights even as we work to support the IC in doing everything required to collect indispensable information from our foreign adversaries.

This Congress has an opportunity to course-correct from the Biden administration’s failures, promote common-sense peace through strength, and re-focus our nation's intelligence and counterintelligence community against our adversaries. Right now, terrorists, rogue regimes, and foreign state-actors are rapidly developing new ways to exploit and harm America’s national interests, and it’s our responsibility to ensure intelligence agencies remain three steps ahead of our enemies. And now, more than ever, leaks and indiscretions by misguided intelligence staff can endanger Americans and hinder our ability to predict and prevent attacks. Everyone on the Committee and within the IC must be devoted to secrecy regarding the material we review. The lives of our covert agents in the field, and the security of our homeland, depend on it.

The Committee has a unique opportunity to work toward rebuilding our intelligence apparatus so that our IC is focused on the challenges of today and is prepared for the threats of tomorrow. It is our aim to rebuild relationships with our partners in the Western Hemisphere, address issues with the development of IC assessments, determine which intelligence tools are needed to protect Americans, and provide our brave men and women in the U.S. intelligence services with the support they need. In our age of increasing threats from abroad and bloated bureaucracy at home, the Committee will be committed to preventing enemies’ attacks and upholding the privacy rights of all American citizens.

I want to thank Chairman Turner for his work in the 118th Congress. He led our committee ably and admirably, at a time when there was a distinct need for a steady hand. He is a valued member of our Conference, and I will build from the solid base his leadership provided this committee.

I want to congratulate my good friend and colleague on his re-election as Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives. Mike Johnson is a man of honor and conviction who has shown the American people that true leadership comes from the heart of a servant. The job of Speaker isn’t easy. It requires hard-work, sacrifice, determination, and a collegial spirit ready to do what is best for our country. Mike Johnson exemplifies all those attributes and more. I was proud to cast my vote for him, and I am proud to serve with him in the 119th Congress as we restore America’s economic might and provide our citizens the pathway to a brighter future.

Arkansas’s First Congressional District produces more steel than any other district in America. The U.S. Steel-Nippon Steel proposed merger would have been an economic boon to my district and to dozens more around the country with a U.S. Steel presence. While the thousands of steel workers in Mississippi County, Arkansas, will continue producing the highest quality, cleanest steel that the world has come to expect from our top-notch factories, I am saddened that politics got in the way of greater investments today. Our national steel-making industry could have been strengthened by this merger. Instead, we must look to the future and hope U.S. Steel can find a way to renew this partnership with our Japanese allies and continue investing in America. One thing I know for certain: Arkansans are ready to make more steel!

After discussions with some of my colleagues who are well-respected leaders in our Conference, I have decided to forego running for T&I chairman this year. I look forward to playing a leading role, however, in crafting and enacting an America First surface transportation bill by September 2026. This decision is in the best interest of the Conference and will promote unity within our ranks. With a tight majority at the beginning of the 119th Congress, which will shrink even more until three special elections are decided in the spring, I believe it’s in our party’s best interest to have complete unity from Day One.

When I announced in March that I was running for the open Transportation and Infrastructure chairman’s seat, I made it clear that my main goal was to pass a new, long-term surface transportation bill with a reformed financing scheme for the Highway Trust Fund. As a valued leader on this committee, I will continue working to make that goal a reality, while unifying our Conference at the same time. Chairman Graves and I have had a long, fruitful working relationship, and I have no doubt we are on the same page about the needs of our surface transportation programs.

President Trump needs every House Republican on-board and working harmoniously with his incoming administration to make the changes necessary to boost economic growth, dismantle inefficient bureaucracies, and deliver for the American people. I wholeheartedly believe in Speaker Johnson’s vision for our Conference, his dedication to working with the Trump administration, and his wise counsel to each of us. A strong, united, and enthusiastic Republican Conference is what America needs. I look forward to serving my fellow members, the Speaker, and Chairman Graves from my role as a T&I Committee leader.
